subject: Re: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel threads?
msgSnippet: ... What surprises you about my response? No doubt, I was disappointed that you didn t contact me prior to distributing JUnitPerf.  It s not that I wouldn t
messageBody:
Michael Silverstein wrote:

>I'm surprised to hear this now Mike, since you and I exchanged a few notes
>when the product was released in July. Looking back at the emails we
>exchanged, your only real comment about it then was, "I would be interested
>to hear anything you hear from your EJU customers about JUnitPerf." I also
>made the comment to you that "I hope it wasn't too presumptuous of us to
>include it", which you never responded to.
>
>

What surprises you about my response?

No doubt, I was disappointed that you didn't contact me prior to
distributing JUnitPerf. It's not that I wouldn't have allowed you to do
so, just that I expected something a little more collegial. The
after-action report stating that it was being distributed and that you
hoped that was cool didn't sit well with me. It didn't come across as
genuine, but perhaps it was just my interpretation. Going back to the
reason for my response, it didn't have that community feel.

>Anyway, I would be happy to remove JUnitPerf from the distribution if it
>bothers you being there, as it is not at all core to the product. If you
>read the documentation you will see that it is described in terms of 'here's
>something else you can do with your tests if you add in a few JUnitPerf
>decorators'. I haven't gotten any feedback from any of our customers that
>they are actually using JUnitPerf in conjunction with Enhanced JUnit.
>

I don't have a problem with it being distributed. The license clearly
grants you permission to do so, and I stand by that license. Whether
you leave it in or not it completely up to you. Your customers seem to
have already decided that your product stands on its own.

I don't want this thread to become a reflection of your product. If
there's follow-up, let's take it offline.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting Inc.
http://www.clarkware.com
